Synopsis: Ever since her father drilled into her head that monogamy isn't realistic, magazine writer Amy (Amy Schumer) has made promiscuity... [More]

Critic_Consensus: No consensus yet.

Cast: Jon Heder, Jon Gries, Aaron Ruell, Efren Ramirez
Critic_Consensus: A charming, quirky, and often funny comedy.

Critic_Consensus: Dudley Moore brings a boozy charm to Arthur, a coming of age tale for a wayward millionaire that deploys energetic cast chemistry and spiffy humor to jovial effect.

Critic_Consensus: Tootsie doesn't squander its high-concept comedy premise with fine dialogue and sympathetic treatment of the characters.

Cast: Mel Brooks, John Candy, Rick Moranis, Bill Pullman
Critic_Consensus: There's fine spoofery and amusing characters in Spaceballs, though it's a far cry from Mel Brooks' peak era.

Critic_Consensus: Girls Trip is the rare R-rated comedy that pushes boundaries to truly comedic effect -- and anchors its laughs in compelling characters brought to life by a brilliantly assembled cast.

Critic_Consensus: An oddball comedy that revels in its silliness and memorable catch phrases, Wayne's World is also fondly regarded because of its endearing characters.

Cast: Cary Grant, Raymond Massey, Priscilla Lane, Peter Lorre
Critic_Consensus: No consensus yet.

Critic_Consensus: While frothy to a fault, Four Weddings and a Funeral features irresistibly breezy humor, and winsome performances from Hugh Grant and Andie MacDowell.

Cast: Buster Keaton, Kathryn McGuire, Ward Crane, Joe Keaton
Critic_Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: Easily excitable Neal Page (Steve Martin) is somewhat of a control freak. Trying to get home to Chicago to spend... [More]
Cast: Steve Martin, John Candy, Laila Robins, Michael McKean

Synopsis: British gangster George Thomason (Tom Georgeson) and his hapless aide, Ken Pile (Michael Palin), draft a pair of arrogant Americans,... [More]
Cast: John Cleese, Jamie Lee Curtis, Kevin Kline, Michael Palin
Critic_Consensus: Smartly written, smoothly directed, and solidly cast, A Fish Called Wanda offers a classic example of a brainy comedy with widespread appeal.

Movie Title: Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
Synopsis: Hotshot television anchorman Ron Burgundy (Will Ferrell) welcomes upstart reporter Veronica Corningstone (Christina Applegate) into the male-dominated world of 1970s... [More]
Cast: Will Ferrell, Christina Applegate, Paul Rudd, Steve Carell

Synopsis: After the members of a team of scientists (Harold Ramis, Dan Aykroyd, Bill Murray) lose their cushy positions at a... [More]
Cast: Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Sigourney Weaver
Critic_Consensus: An infectiously fun blend of special effects and comedy, with Bill Murray's hilarious deadpan performance leading a cast of great comic turns.

Movie Title: Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
Synopsis: A world-class playboy and part-time special agent, Powers is defrosted after 30 years in a cryogenic freeze to match wits... [More]
Cast: Mike Myers, Elizabeth Hurley, Michael York, Mimi Rogers
Critic_Consensus: A light and goofy comedy which provides laughs, largely due to performances and screenwriting by Myers.

Synopsis: Imbecilic best friends Lloyd Christmas (Jim Carrey) and Harry Dunne (Jeff Daniels) stumble across a suitcase full of money left... [More]
Cast: Jim Carrey, Jeff Daniels, Lauren Holly, Teri Garr
Critic_Consensus: A relentlessly stupid comedy elevated by its main actors: Jim Carrey goes bonkers and Jeff Daniels carries himself admirably in an against-type performance.

Critic_Consensus: Enlivening Neil Simon's crackerjack script with their harmonious rapport, Jack Lemmon and Walter Matthau are a perfect pairing as The Odd Couple.

Movie Title: What We Do in the Shadows

Synopsis: It's no accident when wealthy Charles (Henry Fonda) falls for Jean (Barbara Stanwyck). Jean is a con artist with her... [More]

Cast: Barbra Streisand, Ryan O'Neal, Madeline Kahn, Kenneth Mars
Critic_Consensus: Barbra Streisand was never more likable than in this energetic, often hilarious screwball farce from director Peter Bogdanovich.

Synopsis: The Marx Brothers run amuck in the world of opera when Otis B. Driftwood (Groucho Marx) meets aspiring singer Ricardo... [More]
Cast: Groucho Marx, Harpo Marx, Kitty Carlisle, Chico Marx
Critic_Consensus: Watermelons may go out of season, but in A Night at the Opera, the Marx Brothers' daffy laughs are never anything less than uproariously fresh.

Synopsis: A courtroom rivalry finds its way into the household when prosecuting lawyer Adam Bonner (Spencer Tracy) faces off against his... [More]
Cast: Spencer Tracy, Katharine Hepburn, Judy Holliday, Tom Ewell
Critic_Consensus: Matched by Garson Kanin's witty, sophisticated screenplay, George Cukor, Spencer Tracy, and Katherine Hepburn are all in top form in the classic comedy Adam's Rib.

Synopsis: Successful movie director John L. Sullivan (Joel McCrea), convinced he won't be able to film his ambitious masterpiece until he... [More]
Cast: Joel McCrea, Veronica Lake, Robert Warwick, William Demarest
Critic_Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: Danny Noonan (Michael O'Keefe), a teen down on his luck, works as a caddy at the snob-infested Bushwood Country Club... [More]

Cast: Cary Grant, Katharine Hepburn, James Stewart, Ruth Hussey

Synopsis: Shallow, rich and socially successful Cher (Alicia Silverstone) is at the top of her Beverly Hills high school's pecking scale.... [More]

Synopsis: Comedian Alvy Singer (Woody Allen) examines the rise and fall of his relationship with struggling nightclub singer Annie Hall (Diane... [More]
Cast: Woody Allen, Diane Keaton, Tony Roberts, Carol Kane
Critic_Consensus: Filled with poignant performances and devastating humor, Annie Hall represents a quantum leap for Woody Allen and remains an American classic.

Cast: Richard E. Grant, Paul McGann, Richard Griffiths, Ralph Brown

Cast: Dan Aykroyd, Eddie Murphy, Ralph Bellamy, Don Ameche
Critic_Consensus: Featuring deft interplay between Eddie Murphy and Dan Aykroyd, Trading Places is an immensely appealing social satire.

Synopsis: Annie (Kristen Wiig) is a single woman whose own life is a mess, but when she learns that her lifelong... [More]

Synopsis: Respected medical lecturer Dr. Frederick Frankenstein (Gene Wilder) learns that he has inherited his infamous grandfather's estate in Transylvania. Arriving... [More]
Cast: Gene Wilder, Peter Boyle, Cloris Leachman, Marty Feldman
Critic_Consensus: Made with obvious affection for the original, Young Frankenstein is a riotously silly spoof featuring a fantastic performance by Gene Wilder.

Cast: Simon Pegg, Kate Ashfield, Lucy Davis, Nick Frost
Critic_Consensus: Shaun of the Dead cleverly balances scares and witty satire, making for a bloody good zombie movie with loads of wit.

Synopsis: Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen), a rather clueless police detective, tries to foil a plot to turn innocent people into assassins... [More]
Cast: Leslie Nielsen, George Kennedy, Priscilla Presley, Ricardo Montalban
Critic_Consensus: The Naked Gun is loaded chock full of gags that are goofy, unapologetically crass, and ultimately hilarious.

Cast: Eddie Murphy, Arsenio Hall, John Amos, James Earl Jones
Critic_Consensus: Eddie Murphy was in full control at this point, starkly evident in Coming to America's John Landis' coasting direction.

Critic_Consensus: One of the more cutting-edge films of the 1970s, this religious farce from the classic comedy troupe is as poignant as it is funny and satirical.

Cast: Steve Martin, Bernadette Peters, Catlin Adams, Mabel King

Critic_Consensus: Brilliantly filmed and fueled with classic physical comedy, The General captures Buster Keaton at his timeless best.

Critic_Consensus: Smartly directed, brilliantly acted, and packed with endlessly quotable moments, This Is Spinal Tap is an all-time comedy classic.

Critic_Consensus: The talents of director John Landis and Saturday Night Live's irrepressible John Belushi conspired to create a rambunctious, subversive college comedy that continues to resonate.

Synopsis: In this satirical take on Westerns, crafty railroad worker Bart (Cleavon Little) becomes the first black sheriff of Rock Ridge,... [More]
Cast: Cleavon Little, Gene Wilder, Madeline Kahn, Slim Pickens
Critic_Consensus: Daring, provocative, and laugh-out-loud funny, Blazing Saddles is a gleefully vulgar spoof of Westerns that marks a high point in Mel Brooks' storied career.

Synopsis: Harried paleontologist David Huxley (Cary Grant) has to make a good impression on society matron Mrs. Random (May Robson), who... [More]
Cast: Katharine Hepburn, Cary Grant, Charlie Ruggles, May Robson
Critic_Consensus: With Katharine Hepburn and Cary Grant at their effervescent best, Bringing Up Baby is a seamlessly assembled comedy with enduring appeal.

Synopsis: This comedic masterpiece finds the iconic Little Tramp (Charlie Chaplin) employed at a state-of-the-art factory where the inescapable machinery completely... [More]
Cast: Charlie Chaplin, Paulette Goddard, Henry Bergman, Tiny Sandford
Critic_Consensus: A slapstick skewering of industrialized America, Modern Times is as politically incisive as it is laugh-out-loud hilarious.

Cast: Jack Lemmon, Shirley MacLaine, Fred MacMurray, Ray Walston
Critic_Consensus: Director Billy Wilder's customary cynicism is leavened here by tender humor, romance, and genuine pathos.

Synopsis: Phil (Bill Murray), a weatherman, is out to cover the annual emergence of the groundhog from its hole. He gets... [More]

Movie Title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
Synopsis: A film about what could happen if the wrong person pushed the wrong button -- and it played the situation... [More]

Cast: Claudette Colbert, Clark Gable, Walter Connolly, Roscoe Karns
Critic_Consensus: Capturing its stars and director at their finest, It Happened One Night remains unsurpassed by the countless romantic comedies it has inspired.

Cast: Tony Curtis, Jack Lemmon, Marilyn Monroe, George Raft
Critic_Consensus: Some Like It Hot: A spry, quick-witted farce that never drags.

Movie Title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail

Cast: Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Terry Gilliam, Eric Idle

Director: Jim Abrahams, David Zucker, Jerry Zucker
Synopsis: This spoof comedy takes shots at the slew of disaster movies that were released in the 70s. When the passengers... [More]
Cast: Robert Hays, Julie Hagerty, Peter Graves, Robert Stack
Critic_Consensus: Though unabashedly juvenile and silly, Airplane! is nevertheless an uproarious spoof comedy full of quotable lines and slapstick gags that endure to this day.

Cast: Charlie Chaplin, Virginia Cherrill, Harry Myers, Hank Mann
Critic_Consensus: One of the best underdog romance movies ever, with an ending that will light up any heart.

Synopsis: Ray and Danny (Gregory Hines, Billy Crystal) are two Chicago police detectives hot on the trail of drug kingpin Julio... [More]
Cast: Gregory Hines, Billy Crystal, Jimmy Smits, Steven Bauer
Critic_Consensus: Running Scared struggles to strike a consistent balance between violent action and humor, but the chemistry between its well-matched leads keeps things entertaining.

Synopsis: In a futuristic world, a regime has eliminated war by suppressing emotions: books, art and music are strictly forbidden and... [More]
Cast: Christian Bale, Emily Watson, Taye Diggs, Angus Macfadyen
Critic_Consensus: Equilibrium is a reheated mishmash of other sci-fi movies.

Cast: Jet Li, Tony Leung Chiu Wai, Maggie Cheung Man-yuk, Donnie Yen
Critic_Consensus: With death-defying action sequences and epic historic sweep, Hero offers everything a martial arts fan could ask for.

Cast: Patrick Swayze, Kelly Lynch, Sam Elliott, Ben Gazzara
Critic_Consensus: Whether Road House is simply bad or so bad it's good depends largely on the audience's fondness for Swayze -- and tolerance for violently cheesy action.

Critic_Consensus: As fast, loud, and relentless as the train at the center of the story, Unstoppable is perfect popcorn entertainment -- and director Tony Scott's best movie in years.

Synopsis: John Shaft (Richard Roundtree) is the ultimate in suave black detectives. He first finds himself up against Bumpy (Moses Gunn),... [More]
Cast: Richard Roundtree, Moses Gunn, Christopher St. John, Charles Cioffi
Critic_Consensus: This is the man that would risk his neck for his brother, man. Can you dig it?

Synopsis: Honed from childhood to be an elite assassin, Sook-hee embarks on a rampage of violence and revenge to finally earn... [More]
Cast: Kim Ok-bin, Shin Ha-kyun, Sung-joon, Kim Seo-hyung
Critic_Consensus: The Villainess offers enough pure kinetic thrills to satisfy genre enthusiasts -- and carve out a bloody niche for itself in modern Korean action cinema.

Synopsis: When the mystical Russell Nash (Christopher Lambert) kills a man in a sword fight in a New York City parking... [More]
Cast: Christopher Lambert, Sean Connery, Roxanne Hart, Clancy Brown
Critic_Consensus: People hate Highlander because it's cheesy, bombastic, and absurd. And people love it for the same reasons.

Cast: Bruce Willis, Bonnie Bedelia, William Atherton, Reginald VelJohnson

Synopsis: Historian and code-breaker Ben Gates (Nicolas Cage) has been searching his whole life for a rumored treasure dating back to... [More]
Cast: Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Justin Bartha, Sean Bean
Critic_Consensus: National Treasure is no treasure, but it's a fun ride for those who can forgive its highly improbable plot.

Cast: Tony Jaa, Johnny Nguyen, Nathan Jones, Petchtai Wongkamlao
Critic_Consensus: Despite some impressive fight scenes, this trimmed-down version of the Thai action pic is an off-putting mix of scant plot, choppy editing, and confusing subtitles and dubbing.

Synopsis: Jen is enjoying a romantic getaway with her wealthy boyfriend -- until his two sleazy friends arrive for an unannounced... [More]
Cast: Matilda Lutz, Kevin Janssens, Vincent Colombe, Guillaume Bouchède
Critic_Consensus: Revenge slices and dices genre tropes, working within an exploitation framework while adding a timely -- yet never less than viscerally thrilling -- feminist spin.

Cast: Carlos Gallardo, Consuelo Gómez, Reinol Martinez, Peter Marquardt
Critic_Consensus: Made on a shoestring budget, El Mariachi's story is not new. However, the movie has so much energy that it's thoroughly enjoyable.

Synopsis: Ku Shen Chai (Chun Shih), an unmotivated artist in his early 30s, still lives with his mother, but he is... [More]
Cast: Feng Hsu, Chun Shih, Pai Ying, Roy Chiao
Critic_Consensus: A brilliantly directed feast for the eyes with an epic story to match, A Touch of Zen marks a groundbreaking achievement in the wuxia genre.

Synopsis: The Top Gun Naval Fighter Weapons School is where the best of the best train to refine their elite flying... [More]
Cast: Tom Cruise, Kelly McGillis, Anthony Edwards, Val Kilmer
Critic_Consensus: Though it features some of the most memorable and electrifying aereial footage shot with an expert eye for action, Top Gun offers too little for non-adolescent viewers to chew on when its characters aren't in the air.

Cast: Nicolas Cage, John Cusack, John Malkovich, Steve Buscemi
Critic_Consensus: Con Air won't win any awards for believability - and all involved seem cheerfully aware of it, making some of this blockbuster action outing's biggest flaws fairly easy to forgive.

Synopsis: Mercenary leader Barney Ross (Sylvester Stallone), Lee Christmas (Jason Statham) and the rest of the Expendables team reunite when Mr.... [More]
Cast: Sylvester Stallone, Jason Statham, Jet Li, Dolph Lundgren
Critic_Consensus: Taut, violent, and suitably self-deprecating, The Expendables 2 gives classic action fans everything they can reasonably expect from a star-studded shoot-'em-up -- for better and for worse.

Synopsis: The Mummy is a rousing, suspenseful and horrifying epic about an expedition of treasure-seeking explorers in the Sahara Desert in... [More]
Cast: Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo
Critic_Consensus: It's difficult to make a persuasive argument for The Mummy as any kind of meaningful cinematic achievement, but it's undeniably fun to watch.

Cast: Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Vince Vaughn, Adam Brody

Cast: Jackie Chan, Chris Tucker, Tom Wilkinson, Elizabeth Peña
Critic_Consensus: A kick-ass addition to the cop-buddy film genre.

Critic_Consensus: The Equalizer is more stylishly violent than meaningful, but with Antoine Fuqua behind the cameras and Denzel Washington dispensing justice, it delivers.

Synopsis: Political pressure mounts to install a system of accountability when the actions of the Avengers lead to collateral damage. The... [More]
Cast: Chris Evans, Robert Downey Jr., Scarlett Johansson, Sebastian Stan
Critic_Consensus: Captain America: Civil War begins the next wave of Marvel movies with an action-packed superhero blockbuster boasting a decidedly non-cartoonish plot and the courage to explore thought-provoking themes.

Synopsis: After making a speech in Moscow vowing to never negotiate with terrorists, President James Marshall (Harrison Ford) boards Air Force... [More]
Cast: Harrison Ford, Gary Oldman, Glenn Close, Wendy Crewson
Critic_Consensus: This late-period Harrison Ford actioner is full of palpable, if not entirely seamless, thrills.

Cast: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Donald Gibb, Leah Ayres, Norman Burton
Critic_Consensus: This is where it all began for the Muscles from Brussels, but beyond Van Damme's athleticism, Bloodsport is a cliched, virtually plotless exercise in action movie recycling.

Cast: Wesley Snipes, Stephen Dorff, Kris Kristofferson, N'Bushe Wright
Critic_Consensus: Though some may find the plot a bit lacking, Blade's action is fierce, plentiful, and appropriately stylish for a comic book adaptation.

Cast: Martin Lawrence, Will Smith, Tea Leoni, Tcheky Karyo
Critic_Consensus: Bad Boys stars Will Smith and Martin Lawrence have enjoyable chemistry; unfortunately, director Michael Bay too often drowns it out with set pieces and explosions in place of an actual story.

Cast: Bruce Willis, Jeremy Irons, Samuel L. Jackson, Graham Greene
Critic_Consensus: Die Hard with a Vengeance benefits from Bruce Willis and Samuel L. Jackson's barbed interplay, but clatters to a bombastic finish in a vain effort to cover for an overall lack of fresh ideas.

Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Maria Conchita Alonso, Richard Dawson, Yaphet Kotto
Critic_Consensus: The Running Man is winking sci-fi satire with ridiculous clothes and workmanlike direction.

Synopsis: In Chicago, honor-driven Sgt. Eddie Cusack (Chuck Norris) and his team stake out a drug exchange involving notorious drug czar... [More]
Cast: Chuck Norris, Henry Silva, Bert Remsen, Mike Genovese
Critic_Consensus: No consensus yet.

Synopsis: After saving a newborn infant from assassins, carrot-crunching gunman Mr. Smith (Clive Owen) teams up with a prostitute named DQ... [More]
Cast: Clive Owen, Paul Giamatti, Monica Bellucci, Daniel Pilon
Critic_Consensus: As preposterous and over-the-top as Shoot 'Em Up may be, its humor and non-stop action make for a very enjoyable film.

Cast: Jason Statham, Amy Smart, Jose Pablo Cantillo, Efren Ramirez
Critic_Consensus: Crank's assaultive style and gleeful depravity may turn off casual action fans, but audiences seeking a strong dose of adrenaline will be thrilled by Jason Statham's raucous race against mortality.

Movie Title: Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer

Movie Title: The Bird With the Crystal Plumage

Synopsis: Suzy (Jessica Harper) travels to Germany to attend ballet school. When she arrives, late on a stormy night, no one... [More]

Synopsis: Deckard (Harrison Ford) is forced by the police Boss (M. Emmet Walsh) to continue his old job as Replicant Hunter.... [More]

Critic_Consensus: More than straight monster-movie fare, Gojira offers potent, sobering postwar commentary.

Movie Title: The Tale of the Princess Kaguya

Synopsis: ... [More]
